Job_Descriptions: FactSet’s analytical tools are a major pillar in FactSet’s diverse product offering. In order to scale our business as we move towards double digit growth, it is imperative that we expand our current GCS model to include complete and focused coverage of the Analytics product suite and user classes.   The responsibilities of this department will focus on: Portfolio and Quant product suite Plan Sponsor clients Performance/Risk user class Client Services, Sales, Marketing user class We are seeking driven individuals with a passion for supporting our Analytics suite to join the Analytics & Trading Client Solutions team.  The ideal candidate will possess exceptional technical skills as well as the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and effectively to clients of varying levels of sophistication.  We seek someone who is enthusiastic, intellectually curious, and takes pride in the work they do.  Although highly demanding, this role offers the opportunity to become an expert in all areas of the Analytics suite, while directly impacting the investment processes of our client base.   Additionally, this role presents the opportunity to get in on the ground floor and have a large influence on the shape of a brand new team at FactSet.  The team is targeting an average tenure of 2-3 years, which will be facilitated by future opportunities in management and product SME subspecialization. Responsibilities: Develop a comprehensive understanding of the Analytics suite Provide industry leading client service and support to existing Analytics clients Support a book of business of existing Analytics users, meeting specific account objectives each fiscal half through visits, telephone/web consultantations, and email communication Act as a bullpen resource for General Sales, Specialty Sales, and IM Consulting to address time-sensitive needs Proactively identify and engage low usage clients Organize and relay client feedback for enhancements and bugs to Product Development Requirements: Sound understanding of FactSet’s clients and user workflows Proven technical proficiency particularly with writing complex screening codes Strong track record in past and current roles Strong working knowledge of the financial markets and Quantitative workflows Extremely detail-oriented with the ability to see the big picture Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with shifting responsibilities Enthusiasm, strong sense of initiative and a desire to take ownership of project work Willingness to travel For internal - only Employees with a minimum of 18 months client facing experience can apply

About Swiss Re Corporate Solutions Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer. We anticipate and manage risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Swiss Re Corporate Solutions is the commercial insurance arm of the Swiss Re Group. We offer innovative insurance solutions to large and midsized multinational corporations from our approximately 50 locations worldwide. We help clients mitigate their risk exposure, whilst our industry-leading claims service provides them with additional peace of mind. Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. Swiss Re Corporate Solutions embraces a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work. About the role Would you like to take part in all processes and products related to financially steer and partner in corporate insurance? Are you passionate about strategic financial management? Grab this opportunity to personally excel as a senior financial analyst with Swiss Re Corporate Solutions in Asia Pacific: strengthen your technical expertise about the economics of our insurance business, and how underwriting, products, assets and funding produce value for the company. Apply in-depth analytical skill, be part of core business decisions and be presented with the occasion to demonstrate knowledge and entrepreneurial spirit. We offer you exposure to Leaders within the APAC region and the greater Finance community. Your main accountabilities will include but are not limited to: •    Ensure consistent business performance reporting and results analysis for the region, in close collaboration with Finance teams globally. Enable timely understanding of our underlying business performance for the executive leadership, our region, and subregions •    Manage business production projection to ensure a timely and accurate quarterly closing process for Asia Pacific - i.e., you lead timelines, discussions, and responsibilities in coordination with global teams •    Drive our annual cross-functional financial planning discussions between Underwriting, Products and Actuarial teams and enable constructive challenger sessions with regional leadership. Act as a challenger to our business •    Facilitate business partnering and working with the business towards their growth ambitions and initiatives. Build and run financial models to develop and monitor growth investment cases •    Support Underwriters, Products and Sales teams by providing proactive, informative analysis of key performance drivers, expenses, and allocations; Be a true value-adding business partner •    Prepare yourself and the team for the successful implementation of the IFRS accounting and KPI framework and support the knowledge transfer to our regional colleagues •    Provide customized / ad-hoc reporting and analysis by closely collaborating with our overseas colleagues and offshore centres This position offers an outstanding opportunity to boost your career in finance in the corporate insurance industry! About the team The Asia Pacific Finance team in Singapore supports managing and steering Swiss Re's commercial lines primary insurer, the business unit Corporate Solutions, in the region. Your multifaceted and curious manner supports the Head FP&A Asia Pacific to further improve and accurately perform financial analysis and to effectively act as a challenger to our decision makers. With growing responsibility, you will be able to collaborate and partner intensively across our Underwriting, Sales teams and Operations as well as our larger Finance Corporate Solutions community globally. About You •    University graduate with a bachelor's degree or higher in finance/accounting/economics with CA/CPA or similar qualification •    At least 8 years of relevant experience in financial services, planning & analysis or management reporting/controlling •    Strong analytical skills and technical savvy with the capability to communicate complexity in a clear and concise fashion to a non-expert audience •    Prior knowledge of IFRS 17 is an advantage •    Excellent oral and written English •    Ability to perform tasks with a high degree of autonomy but working closely with relevant partners •    Demonstrate a natural sense of curiosity and show personal accountability for area of responsibility •    Willingness to work a flexible schedule as a team •    Excellent Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint) Good with numbers and looking for a chance to demonstrate the skills with us? We look forward to your application! Keywords:   Reference Code: 111405

What the role is Do you love Singapore for its diverse cultural traditions as much as its boldness as a Little Red Dot punching above its weight? Can you identify with the grit exhibited by our founding leaders and generations as they toiled hard in our early nation-building years? If so, we would love for you to join the Founders' Memorial team! You will be part of a passionate team that drives the vision of the Founders’ Memorial to commemorate how independent Singapore came to be. As part of the Partnerships and Engagement team, you will inspire like-minded partners and stakeholders across the public and private sectors to join us in building a Memorial like no other — one that looks beyond the past to the present and future and is created together with Singaporeans. You will strengthen and sustain existing partnerships, as well as devise new and fresh ways of engaging Singaporeans to be part of the Memorial as we gear up towards its opening. What you will be working on Conceptualise and implement strategies, programmes, and campaigns to engage Singaporeans from all walks of life as contributors, volunteers, public and private partners, etc, during the Memorial’s development years in the lead-up to its opening, and for the eventual running of the Memorial. Identify new partners and audience groups for engagement at different junctures of the Memorial's development. Engage youth as the next generation of content and programme co-presenters, through partnerships with educational institutions and other youth-centric organisations and interest groups. Establish and grow a vibrant and active group of volunteers as ambassadors and co-builders of the Memorial through workshops and programmes. Cultivate and sustain an active and engaged network of community leaders, public and private sector partners, etc, who can serve as engagement multipliers for the longer term. Manage public engagements through the Memorial’s communication channels such as responding to public feedback, maintaining our stakeholder database, and producing communications materials. What we are looking for At least 3 years of experience in partnerships or equivalent would be advantageous Keen knowledge and interest in Singapore’s history and heritage and its relevance for the present and future Able to initiate and cultivate relationships with different partners and stakeholders Confident in public speaking and networking in large and small groups Resourceful, and strong in knowledge and project management Excellent presentation and organisational skills Interest and working knowledge in harnessing digital for public engagement Able to work independently and as part of a core team Bilingual with excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Experience in public policy and/or in a role pertaining to citizen engagement and/or volunteer management is preferred

Sales Operation Analyst (based in Singapore) Our Client is a one of the Global Top Manufacturing and Engineering Software Vendors. They are seeking for a Sales Operation Analyst to support the sales team for sales process, reporting, and CRM requirements. This role is based in Singapore and covers SE Asia. Responsibilities: • Process high volume of direct and indirect sales orders and provide general sales support to achieve objectives (reporting, planning and analysis) • Act as customer’s point of contact • Work independently in resolving business issues effectively and productively with systems and data • Work on daily administrative tasks and general duties in the sales department • Responsible in documenting operational processes, ensure efficiency and high quality work • Utilize Salesforce CRM to perform data export and contract recording • Ensure compliance with internal policies and regulations such as communicating clearly to distributors on license compliance for selling to different countries in SE Asia • Quarter-end overtime working will be required Requirements: • Bachelor in Business or related disciplines • Around 8 to 15 years of experience in sales operation positions from MNC • Strong skills in Excel (such as using wizards and Pivot Table) and Power Point • Highly Organized with strong time-management skills and ability to multi-task • Able to work independently, a self-starter and highly motivated • Good attention to detail and procedure management skills • Fast learner with the ability to adapt to a fast growing environment • Experience in using Salesforce CRM is a plus • Good communication and presentation skills in English • Willing to travel (less than 20%) Apply Now Refer a Friend

Hiring_Company: Ministry Of Social And Family Development
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Children in Care Service (CIC) oversees the provision of out-of-home care options such as foster care, kinship care or children's homes to vulnerable children. CIC works closely with various partners to provide a continuum of out-of-home care sector, and to grow and develop essential capabilities and services to strengthen the care options for these children and help them to grow up to become contributing members of society. You will support the foster parents to provide quality care for the foster children who are placed with them and you will also play a key role in working with Social Service Agencies appointed as Fostering Agencies (FAs) to ensure effective programme implementation through gaining a good grasp of ground needs and sector capabilities. You will work with internal and external stakeholders to guide the providers, resource them, and develop and strengthen their capabilities. What you will be working on You will be part of the Fostering Service within the Children in Care Service, and as part of your job scope you will carry out: Assist in the placement of foster children with foster parents Support foster placements to ensure the foster children’s safety and well-being Work with internal and external stakeholders to streamline processes to improve support to foster parents and children in foster care Service management and funding administration for the Fostering Agency providers, which handle over 80% of the children and youth who are in foster care, through: o Engaging the providers closely, monitoring their KPIs and conducting quarterly checks on their deliverables o Disbursing funds to the Fostering Agencies each quarter o Assessing the providers’ performance for reappointment o Guiding FAs in casework and funding matters such as managing challenging cases or the process of applying for subsidies for foster children o Renewing of budget projections based on demand patterns Drive and coordinate implementation projects with other teams to translate policy intent into impactful implementation. This role offers a breadth of exposure to case management, ops-policy, service management, funding administration and stakeholder engagement. What we are looking for Tertiary qualifications At least 3 years of experience in case management and/or service management or funding administration work with MSF-funded agencies will be useful Interest in making a difference to vulnerable children and families Ability to communicate well with different internal and external stakeholders Excellent project management skills, problem-solving skills, comfortable with numbers A team player who is also able to work independently under pressure Attention to detail

Job_Title: Scientist / Senior Scientist - Centre for Animal & Veterinary Sciences
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Animal & Veterinary Service (AVS), a cluster of NParks, safeguards the health and welfare of animals through comprehensive and integrated programmes and works closely with partners in the veterinary and animal-related industries to strengthen capacities and enhance competencies in animal health and welfare. It is the main touch-point on animal and veterinary matters in Singapore and the first responder for all animal-related feedback. It also conducts public education and engagement programmes to foster a humane and gracious society for all, where pet owners, communities, and animals co-exist in greater harmony within our City in Nature. You will be part of the Centre for Animal and Veterinary Sciences (CAVS) team under the Professional and Scientific Services Division of AVS. As a member of the trans-disciplinary team at CAVS, you will be responsible for providing professional and competent laboratory diagnostic and research support for animal and zoonotic disease biosurveillance programmes, various research projects with national and international partners, as well as laboratory services for external customers with the objective of meeting NParks mission to create the best living environment through excellence in nature conservation, greenery and recreation, and veterinary care, in partnership with the community. What you will be working on Perform laboratory diagnostic analysis, as well as undertake projects for method establishment and molecular pathogen characterization, in support of disease outbreak investigations and biosurveillance programmes Perform duties to support quality assurance system in compliance with ISO/IEC 17025:2017 Support validation of Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) and other sequencing platforms for the genetic/genomic analysis of veterinary and zoonotic pathogens What we are looking for Degree in Biology, Biotechnology, Biomedical Science, Life Science, or related science discipline. Preferably with postgraduate qualification in Microbiology, Life Sciences, or related science discipline. Knowledge of ISO 17025:2017 and workplace safety will be advantageous Highly motivated individual with passion for laboratory sciences and its application to support and protect animal health and welfare and biodiversity and conservation Able to balance working independently and in a team environment Competent in Microsoft Office Applications Possess initiative, good leadership, and communication skills (verbal and written) Office Location: The Animal & Plant Health Centre, 6 Perahu Road Singapore 718827 Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Assistant Manager/ Deputy Manager, Registration Division
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As a member of the secretariat team, you will be involved in reviewing and managing the policies and operations of the Healthcare Professional Boards in regulating healthcare professionals. Specifically, these include the areas of registration of healthcare professionals, staffing of Board/Council and professional committee meetings, as well as administrative support to the Boards/Councils. What you will be working on As a member of the secretariat team, you will be involved in reviewing and managing the policies and operations of the Healthcare Professional Boards in regulating healthcare professionals. Specifically, these include the areas of registration of healthcare professionals, staffing of Board/Council and professional committee meetings, as well as administrative support to the Boards/Councils. What we are looking for Relevant working experience in administration operations Possess good writing and communication skills Possess good critical thinking, customer-relationship and information analysis skills Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Powerpoint and Words) Meticulous and able to work independently as well as in a team Self-motivated and positive working attitude

Job_Title: Assistant Director (Compensation and Organisational Design), HR Policy, PSD
Job_Descriptions: What the role is [Hiring Cluster’s Description] We ensure that our compensation and benefits package is market competitive to attract and retain our talent. Through our performance management system, we aim to motivate our officers to put in their best to achieve agency and Public Service outcomes. We also oversee organisational design, superannuation and exit matters of the Service. What you will be working on [Specific Job Responsibilities] Reporting to the Deputy Director, you will lead a team to: Formulate policies and solutions pertaining to compensation, organisational design, organisational structure planning and job grading/evaluation for the Singapore Civil Service. This involves reviewing and analysing internal practices to understand the needs and challenges across the Civil Service; and developing deep expertise and specialist knowledge in (a) formulating performance and market-based rewards framework and compensation packages and (b) organisational design, organisational structure planning, job grading/evaluation methodologies. Study best practices in the private and public sector in reviewing how Public Service compensation policies can evolve to meet future needs. Identify and evaluate competitive threats, labour and market trends, and anticipating future challenges in the area of total rewards. Provide consulting services and guidance to the Ministries and Business Partners in total rewards strategy and solutions. Work with the PSD Data Office and HR systems teams to define the various data products and data needed to support timely analytics in the area of compensation policy; and with the Human Resource Leaders to ensure that the analysis meets their needs. What we are looking for [Values] We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. [Competencies] An ideal candidate should possess the following: [Analytics and Sensitivity to Numbers/Data Processing] Comfortable with quantitative analysis, particularly in Excel. Ability to extract and distil complex analysis into key decision points for senior stakeholders. [Thinking Clearly and Making Sound Judgements] Curiosity about problems, the drive to follow analyses to their logical conclusion, and the resourcefulness to navigate the prevailing policy context to design and implement effective and timely solutions. Ability to understand historical precedent in context, determine applicability to current scenarios, and triangulate against current best practice to design effective and timely solutions. [Working Effectively with Stakeholders] Ability to communicate complex issues and policy solutions to public officers. Possess strong writing and verbal communication skills. Willingness and drive to effectively engage a range of stakeholders to ensure that policy is successfully implemented. [HR Policy] Ability to advise and take the lead on holistic HR policy reviews involving interrelated HR policies and processes, while considering potential implementation issues. Appreciation of the dynamism between different areas of HR policies and how they interrelate as an ecosystem. [Compensation] Knowledge and appreciation of compensation principles and practices to lead the reviews of compensation programmes and initiatives. Experience in salary benchmarking, salary structure and incentives design will be beneficial. [Organisation Design]: Ability to design and conduct organisational diagnosis and strategic visioning with stakeholders to assess and analyse current state and needs. Ability to integrate different job grades to develop the proposed organisation structure. [Work Experience] At least 5 years of experience in policy development or HR work, preferably leading a team and in the related areas of compensation and job grading/evaluation, as well as organisational design and organisational structure planning. Familiarity and experience with data processes would be advantageous. This entails understanding best practices, engaging stakeholders to co-create a portfolio of standard and customised data products, and working with systems and processes to ensure that data is captured and analysed in a way that is useful to stakeholders. [Personal Traits] Meticulous with an eye for detail. Self-starter who is able to work independently and work well under pressure. Applicants will typically be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of the job posting. Successful candidates will be appointed on a 2-year contract in the first instance.

Location: Pandan Loop, Clementi, 128355, West Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Job Description: Inventory Operator The functions of a Warehouse Operator are that of completing and coordinating the day-to-day warehouse operational functions of packing, shipping, receiving and inventory control of meat products. The products include beef, pork, chicken, lamb, etc. A Warehouse Operator is required to work under the administration of Warehouse Supervisor and efficiently as well as accurately conduct all duties and responsibilities assigned. Essential Functions (Job Duties and Responsibilities): • Performs inventory movement task in chiller and freezer (thermal wear to keep maximum warmth is provided by company). • Operating sit-down and/or stand-up forklift (for candidates with forklift license). • Perform physical and system receipts of all incoming shipments. • Picking orders and processing orders for shipment. • Loading & unloading trucks. • Working in a team environment, safely. • Cycle counts and other inventory related functions. • Keeping warehouse clean and organized. • Following all safety procedures and regulations. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 20-30kg between short distance. Required Education and Experience: • No education expectation is required for the job. • At least 3 years of warehouse experience. • Forklift Operator gets higher salary. • This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. • The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 20-30kg between short distance. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: • This is a full-time position, Monday – Friday (7:30am – 4:30pm) & Saturday (7:30am to 11:30am), may require Holiday and OT work. Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH806676 Feb 11, 2022 S$50-99k Job Description A Security Operations Analyst/SOC Analyst works in a team to monitor and help protect an organization from security breaches and cyberattacks. This is to be achieved in part by a multi-year system and flow convergence program, as well as consolidating functions across Operations to form a broader Equity middle office. Job_Title: Measurement Product Specialist, Large Customer Sales
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience with measurement platforms, analytics, and attribution modeling. Preferred qualifications: Experience with implementation/configuration of Measurement, Web Analytics or Attribution Strategy including: data-driven attribution/non-last click attribution, cross-device measurement, conversion tracking, Geo-Experiments, incrementally/lift, online-to-offline measurement, offline data import. Experience with leading third-party measurement, site analytics, CRM, and data systems. Experience in working with and influencing advertiser/agency decision-makers. Knowledge of Google measurement capabilities across ad and media platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Search Ads 360, and Analytics). Understanding of the digital ad ecosystem and recent privacy changes. About the job Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. As a Measurement Specialist (MS), you will help advertisers scale their use of Google measurement and attribution solutions to drive measurement maturity. You will have product expertise in specific Google measurement solutions and action on the insights produced. You'll work closely with Large Customer Sales (LCS) pods and help advertisers deploy the latest measurement technologies to drive measurement maturity in the South East Asia (SEA) region. You'll utilize your understanding of industry practices, digital media trends, analytical abilities and their persuasive influencing skills to convince advertisers to take the necessary actions to properly determine brand, media customer value, and channel impact. You will be aligned at the country level and may develop strategic measurement plans for the book of business, develop activation plans, and track progress against them. Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. Resposibilities Activate SEA strategy through deep client consultations and product roll-out, increasing privacy foundations product adoption and 1PD integration. Utilize product and feature adoption in Analytics, and support other product specialists with complex attribution cases. Have client conversations around advanced measurement or full funnel measurement. Work on alignment to product with Go-To-Market teams for Fund Programs management and client activation.

About the Job As key personnel of the team, you are expected to lead, develop and maintain capabilities to provide high quality of care to meet the diverse needs of children entering the small group home programme. You are also to lead the daily operations of the unit and to ensure that the safety and welfare of the clients are taken care of. You need to support the Manager in the coaching and supervision of residential care staff team including and offer guidance to ensure smooth work delivery in the centre and observe the Standards of Care while upholding the ethics and ethos of the social/youth work practice. Job Responsibilities Oversight 24/7 operations of the small group home; ensuring the safety and welfare of both staff and clients and to lead and support the residential home staff involved in the management of the clients. To support in providing supervision to interns on placements, programe executives/social work assistants and all care team staffs or any other staffs in consultation with the Manager. To support in setting and reviewing targets and objectives of the unit(s) programme on a regular basis. To support in developing and review Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) in compliance with the Ministry (MSF) and Licensing guidelines. To support Manager in ensuring that all staffs are well trained and abide by the Home’s philosophy, mission, objectives and operating principles in carrying out their duties. To suppport Manager in ensuring that staff resources are adequate and oversight staff roster to promote quality service standards and workflow efficiency. To support Manager in ensuring residential programme is functioning optimally and that licensing requirements are achieved. Provide oversight on the progress of behavior management practices so as to ensure delivery of quality and effective intervention and services are in line with case plan. Ensure structured programs are engaging and therapeutic in intervening with children and young persons, with the aim to meet the physical, social, emotional and educational needs of the clients. Monitor and maintain meaningful daily programmes to ensure the clients are kept sufficiently and constructively engaged. Provide oversight to Programme and Volunteer assistants/executives. Evaluate the outcome of projects and the program against its respective objectives. Job requirements Preferably a degree in Social Work, Counseling or Psychology. Interested applicants who has degree of other discipline or at least 3 years of direct Residential Care experiences may apply. Working Hours 44 working hours per week Work Location The Salvation Army – Haven Children’s Home 350 Pasir Panjang Rd, Singapore 118692 The Haven is a residential home to care for children and young people who are unable to be cared for by their own families. We provide a comprehensive residential care programme, specially designed and directed towards preparing their reintegration into the community and reunion with their families. At The Haven, social workers and care staff work towards building a close relationship with the children and young people, seeking to be a friend, teacher and counsellor to help them overcome their past hurts and to build up their resilience to face the future with a positive attitude. We also provide a programme which specialises in an alternative care approach for teenagers who require further assistance while pursuing post-secondary education, known as [email protected] This hostel living arrangement helps them learn necessary life skills and encourage independent living.

We are looking for a suitable candidate to join our Equities Operations team as an Associate/AVP. The Equities Operations team covers Trade, Corporate Actions and Proxy Operations for the Equities Asset Class. The successful candidate shall work primarily in the Trade Operations team with a focus on the support of structured Equities deals.  We continuously seek for areas to improve upon so as to achieve higher efficiency and reduced operational risk. Responsibilities Deals Support Support the business in the closing of structured Equities deals including PIPE, cornerstones, private placements, pre-IPO and other strategic equity investments. Partner with investment professionals from deal initiation to closing. Ensure on-going communication in working closely with the internal stakeholders (legal, tax, operations, compliance) and external parties to achieve a concerted and timely closing. Monitor various approval and docs submission deadlines, clear communication and timely escalation of issues that might impact the investment timeline, round up relevant parties to offer and drive resolution. Identify systematic issues and area of improvements that can sharpen the closing process, work closely with process stakeholders to improve the process and framework. Proactively manage expectations of all stakeholders and resolve issues in a professional and tactful manner. Trade Operations Support the business in the trading activities of Equities asset classes. Perform trade processing of various Equities instruments, including: Cash Equities, Exchange-traded Futures & Options, OTC Swaps and Options. Perform transaction processing for Payments. Ensure prompt receipt and matching of trade confirmations. Ensure timely settlement for all trades across the global markets. This includes ensuring sufficient funding and meeting both the internal and custodian banks’ cut-off times. Ensure prompt follow up on trade matching, trade confirmation, settlement, and other operational matters Assessment for implementation of new products and markets for investment by portfolio managers. Work with external counterparties, brokers and service providers to resolve operational issues, and be able to assess their service levels. Ensure service level is met for all services. Work with external vendors (brokers, counterparties, clearers, custodian banks, industry groups) to keep track of market developments. Others Drive process improvements for productivity and quality enhancements; design solutions to integrate into processes Participate in system enhancement UAT and continuous process improvements. Leverage on technological/automation tools coupled with strong understanding of business needs, in order to streamline work processes. Participate in cross-team collaboration through projects. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree or higher. At least 3 years working experience in Operations, preferably in a buy-side asset manager. Inquisitive and curious, detail-oriented, strong analytical ability, multitasking, excellent communication skills and possess a drive for excellence. Constantly keep up-to-date with industry developments, resourceful. Able to work effectively under pressure to meet tight deadlines and multiple priorities. A good team player, collaborates well with internal and external counterparts, self-motivated and enjoys working in a dynamic environment. Some experience interacting with investment professionals and traders is an added advantage, but not a pre-requisite. Ability to work under tight timelines for deal closing. Ability to identity issues and propose solutions to ensure smooth closure of the deal.

Job_Title: Senior Digital Marketing Specialist -Real OD Digital Solutions
Location: One Commonwealth, 1, Commonwealth Lane, Nepal Hill, Queenstown, Singapore, 149544, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Senior Digital Marketing Specialist - Real OD Digital Solutions Since 1998 PACE OD Consulting has been advancing Real® organisational development (OD) practice to positively impact organisations globally. In line with our mission to serve global organisations and individuals, we invite passionate, experienced, talented individuals to join our OD team as Senior Digital Marketing Specialist- Digital OD Solutions (DODS). The Digital Marketing Specialist identifies business market opportunities and co-develops a business plan with the supervisor to launch, grow and sustain agreed marketing goals for the DODS. The position reports to the Executive Director while working very cohesively with the Consultants and colleagues from IT, Graphic Design, Finance and Operations. Key Responsibilities: Conduct and update market research on the global markets for DODS. Provide market reports to the Leadership Team and recommend effective actions. Co-develop and own a solid DODS business plan with revenue targets for the next 3-5 years. Craft sub-business marketing plans for the different offerings in DODS. Implement the plans toward realising the DODS business goals. Design and deliver digital marketing campaigns and toolkits to engage the identified target markets of the various product offerings under DODS Establish and execute end-to-end digital marketing campaigns and strategies that include digital media planning and buying, search engine optimisation, conversion rate optimisation and data and analytics and more to align with the needs and goals of the DODS. Lead the analytics and reporting function in digital campaigns with a focus on optimisation to yield brand awareness, adoption and loyalty. Work closely with the Leadership Team Digital. IT, Design and Consulting teams to ensure that the digital marketing technology/strategy aligns with the organisation’s broader digital strategy and efforts. Develop and lead the implementation of the long-term data and analytics capability, in consultation with the Leadership Team. Serve and manage business/channel partners in the distribution of DODS offerings in the identified markets. Any other related activities that are deemed essential for developing and growing DODS globally. What Success Looks Like Highly motivated to deliver business and revenue targets, in line with the goals of the DODS business unit within the agreed timeframe to achieve DODS business goals. Demonstrate positive relationship-building skills in engagements with the internal OD team and colleagues. Identify target markets for DODs to support the business plan for DODs based on real market research. Effectively design, implement and drive digital end-to-end digital marketing campaigns and strategy to create brand awareness, brand adoption and brand loyalty for DODS. Relate well with direct DODs clients, local business/channel partners in the respective markets. Qualifications and Experience A University degree (preferably with business/Marketing/HR/OD/L&D discipline) Possess a great drive to succeed Strong sense of business acumen Experienced in marketing, brand management and channel management. Digitally adept with all social media platforms usage and • Excellent strategic thinking and leadership skills • Able to drive innovation and brand growth Proficient in English with excellent communication and presentation skills Skilled and experienced in social media marketing. Carousell is the leading classifieds group in Greater Southeast Asia on a mission to inspire the world to start selling, and to make secondhand the first choice. Founded in August 2012 in Singapore, the group has a leading presence in eight markets under the brands Carousell, Mudah.my, Cho Tot, OneKyat and Ox Street, serving tens of millions of monthly active users. We have three technology development centres in Singapore, Taiwan and India, as well as offices in Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Carousell is backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, STIC Investments and Sequoia Capital India. As a team of passionate individuals working together to solve meaningful problems, there is so much more for you to discover in a career with Carousell. Our culture is made up of hiring, developing, and promoting people who embody our values of solving problems for our users; having a mission-first mindset; being relentlessly resourceful; caring deeply; and staying humble to constantly improve. Together as an organisation, we make magic happen. About the role As a young and expanding organisation, we are looking to hire a Technical Talent Acquisition Researcher to join our Singapore team. In this role, the recruiter will help in identifying, screening, building a strong pipeline of best-in-class talent for Carousell and hiring qualified candidates through active headhunting. You will also partner with the People Team and focus on creating an engaging candidate experience, building a strong employer brand for the Carousell Group and being a trusted Talent advisor to our business leaders. Responsibilities: Partner with recruiters and recruiting leaders to help develop an overall sourcing strategy and building of a robust pipeline for Core engineering, data & product profiles. Ensure there is a constant, quality candidate pipeline. Assist in evaluating various sourcing channels and tools along with recruiters. Conducting phone screening, evaluating candidates motivations and availability. And initial assessment of candidate capabilities. Develop relevant and effective sourcing strategies and provide consultative services to meet recruitment needs; lead searches, build a network with key talents in the market and a healthy candidates pipeline for strategic/critical roles Build a robust talent pipeline through engagement with targeted universities, companies, interest and network groups, particularly in the Technology/Engineering space Key Requirements: 1-3 years of experience in Talent Acquisition Sourcing; Agency or in-house recruitment experience and the ability to manage high volume of technical hiring; Experience in hiring for software engineering/software product (Product Managers, Product Designers, Data Scientists, UX Researches, Content Designer) talents across multiple regions ​​ Experience in a start-up/fast-paced organisation within the Technology sector or Classifieds or E-commerce space preferred; Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and ability to provide great candidates’ experience; Highly collaborative and able to manage stakeholders Note: Due to the high volume of applicants. Only shortlisted will be notified. Agencies: Please do not call or email any employee of Carousell Group outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, to the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property/ownership of Carousell Group and, in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid. By clicking on Submit, you are accepting to our PDPA policies. In case you are interested to know more, read about our Candidates Personal Data Privacy Statement [https://support.carousell.com/hc/en-us/articles/4410378144537-Candidates-Personal-Data-Privacy-Statement].

If you think you’re right for the job and wish to be part of our new team, please send your CV to **@slingshot.sg and indicate the following: - Availability - Last drawn salary We’ll get in touch with you if we find you suitable.

Responsibilities: Provide recruitment support to the Talent Acquisition (TA) team Oversee interview arrangements and collation of supporting documents Provide excellent experience to both internal and external stakeholders throughout the recruiting process Participate in other ad-hoc HR activities as required Requirements: Strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office products, especially MS Teams and MS Outlook Meticulous personality with a keen eye for details Good communication skills Client-oriented and professional in handling business correspondence with stakeholders Efficient time management skills, with the ability to balance numerous requirements at a time Fast learner and independent worker who can also thrive as a contributing team member Ability to maintain strict confidentiality Currently pursuing a degree in Human Resources, business administration or in a related field Fortinet is an Equal Opportunity employer.   We will only notify shortlisted candidates.   Fortinet will not entertain any unsolicited resumes, please refrain from sending them to any Fortinet employees or Fortinet email aliases. Should any Agency submit any resumes to Fortinet, these resumes if considered, will be assumed to have been given by the Agency free of any related fees/charges. #LI-NH1 Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) secures the largest enterprise, service provider, and government organizations around the world. Fortinet empowers its customers with intelligent, seamless protection across the expanding attack surface and the power to take on ever-increasing performance requirements of the borderless network - today and into the future. Only the Fortinet Security Fabric architecture can deliver security features without compromise to address the most critical security challenges, whether in networked, application, cloud or mobile environments. Fortinet ranks number one in the most security appliances shipped worldwide and more than 450,000 customers trust Fortinet to protect their businesses.

Mavis has the distinction of being the most trusted pioneer brand in the tuition industry since 1986 and the only wholly-owned industry leader. Over the years, thousands of students have benefitted from our guidance and seen tangible improvements in their academic results. We have a team of dedicated teachers who have worked closely with our students in helping them fulfil their potential. It is this commitment that has contributed to our success, propelling our growth from 1 – 15 branches. Today, we remain steadfast in our mission to provide excellence in educational services both within Singapore and across the region. Do you have what it takes to be part of the Mavis family? Are you a motivated individual who is committed to challenges? Do you have the passion to inspire your students and a desire to nurture their minds through engaging lessons? Supplier Management & Sourcing Lead (Oil & Gas) Location: Benoi Company Transport Provided (Boon Lay) Salary Up to $5500 depending on experience AWS + VB Job Summary: Responsible for leading & managing the sourcing process for a Center to deliver optimal product and service cost, and a high-performance, risk-managed supply base in line with the business requirements. Manages a Sourcing Specialist supporting NPD projects, non-inventory enquiries and other improvement activities. Responsibilities: Initiate and create Sourcing Plans that reduce cost, secure supply and minimize supply chain disruptions, aligned with Category strategies. Develop action plans, timelines and resource assignments for sourcing projects, including the assignment of projects from Category, supply risk mitigations or continuous Improvement activities. Manage & execute sourcing activities to support the Tech Centers on direct spend requirements and local requirements. Support through the identification of suppliers, RFQ and engaging the GSC and other stakeholders as required. Define a high-performance supply base for locally managed commodities. Lead the request for information, quotation, proposal and bidding processes, minimizing risk and maximizing value in terms of quality, delivery, total cost of ownership and compliance to CLM Procedure. Lead the supplier evaluation and selection processes, in coordination with Supplier Quality teams and Supplier Managers. Ensure all decisions for selection and onboarding are documented. Execute new supplier screening and onboarding processes. Strategize negotiation of prices and terms with suppliers to meet quality, delivery and cost objectives. Lead the contracting process with suppliers in coordination with Supply Chain Contract Manager. Monitor sourcing projects to ensure on-time completion and full implementation, including all Purchasing data required to transact. Engage with all appropriate stakeholders to meet defined objectives and ensure the effective implementation of Sourcing Plans. Identify opportunities and implement actions to continuously reduce wasted time, money and resources. Comply with all Schlumberger and local procedures applicable to the job function. Ensure full compliance throughout the Center with Schlumberger Financial Manual and Sourcing Procedures. Conduct constant supplier engagement & development for critical suppliers to ensure sufficient capacity, resources and materials to complete the refurbishment units. Plan, execute and support in supplier audits. Drive and monitor favorable inflation activities to ensure the objectives are met. Liaise with stakeholders and lead non-conformance related issues that are due to supplier's fault. Work closely with Procurement, Customer Service, Planning and Manufacturing to ensure delivery timeline is met. Be the pivotal/escalation point for managed suppliers' portfolio from internal stakeholders. Monitor and ensure service levels from critical suppliers are met. Support in rapid response request from the Customer Service or Engineering Team. Initiate and drive activities to reduce supplier lead time Strategize to improve on other commercial terms. Ensure Supplier Performance Management according to Supplier Management Plan. Requirements: Minimum 5 years of Supplier Management and Sourcing Lead Experience in fast pace MNC. Effective communication, influencing, problem-solving, negotiation, presentation skills. Supplier Relationship Management and the ability to navigate the organization and influence decisions. Short/long term planning foresight, commercially focused, pragmatic, proactive and results-driven. A high sense of urgency. Relevant tertiary educations in Supply Chain, Business Administration/Management or Engineering. Experience in Sharepoint, Power BI, SAP, Ariba Well informed on commodity prices fluctuations. Understanding their impact on the managed portfolio. Familiarization of automation software such as Robotics Process Automation. Job Description: Inventory Operator The functions of a Warehouse Operator are that of completing and coordinating the day-to-day warehouse operational functions of packing, shipping, receiving and inventory control of meat products. The products include beef, pork, chicken, lamb, etc. A Warehouse Operator is required to work under the administration of Warehouse Supervisor and efficiently as well as accurately conduct all duties and responsibilities assigned. Essential Functions (Job Duties and Responsibilities): •Performs inventory movement task in chiller and freezer (thermal wear to keep maximum warmth is provided by company). •Operating sit-down and/or stand-up forklift (for candidates with forklift license). •Perform physical and system receipts of all incoming shipments. •Picking orders and processing orders for shipment. •Loading & unloading trucks. •Working in a team environment, safely. •Cycle counts and other inventory related functions. •Keeping warehouse clean and organized. •Following all safety procedures and regulations. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 20-30kg between short distance. Required Education and Experience: •No education expectation is required for the job. •At least 3 years of warehouse experience. •Forklift Operator gets higher salary. •This position is very active and requires standing, walking, bending, kneeling, stooping, crouching, crawling, and climbing all day. •The employee must frequently lift and/or move items over 20-30kg between short distance. Job Summary Our laboratory is growing rapidly and we are currently seeking a full-time, office-based Sample Management Assistant to join our team. This position will work with a team to accomplish tasks and projects that are instrumental to the company’s success. If you want an exciting career where you can tap on use your previous expertise, and can develop and grow your career further, this is the opportunity for you. Responsibilities Specimen management task including: Tracking, receiving, unpacking, and scanning of diagnostic specimens into database. Maintain specimen storage inventory. Communicate sample discrepancies with internal teams and assist with problem sample resolution. Prepare & coordinate shipments between Medpace & other labs; tasks include preparing airwaybill, pulling & packing of samples. Attend inter-department meetings and review study materials to extract information for shipment document. Mange couriers & external providers. Maintain equipment temperature monitoring and respond to unit alarms. Perform equipment maintenance monthly. Ad-hoc: Investigate and write CAPA reports, process improvement, new project leading. Qualifications Candidate must possess at least a Diploma in any field; At least 2 years of industry experience in related similar position; Team-worker and detail-oriented with good time management skills; Basic knowledge of Microsoft® Word and Excel; Experience in sample management, logistics or laboratory will be advantageous; and Able to work on rotational Saturdays and public holidays. Medpace Overview Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing more than 4,500 people across almost 40 countries. Why Medpace? When you join Medpace, you become part of a team dedicated to supporting the development of ground-breaking drugs and devices. Our employees provide hope for those living with debilitating diseases. We invite you to be a part of something that is impacting millions of people around the globe while enjoying a competitive total compensation and benefits package and internal growth opportunities. Organic Growth: Medpace is continuing to grow in all areas globally and has built an expansive research campus at its headquarters in Cincinnati, OH. In 2020, Medpace opened a new seven story building that is approximately 250,000 SQFT. In total, the headquarter's campus includes five buildings and approximately 600,000 SQFT. The company also has expanding office locations in Dallas, TX and Denver, CO. Perks (vary by location and position): On-site fitness center(s) Campus walking paths Company-sponsored social and wellness events Official Sponsor of FC Cincinnati Hybrid work-from-home options and flexible work schedule On-site Market Place Free and covered parking Discounts for local businesses On campus restaurants and banks coming soon Awards: Medpace historically named a Top Cincinnati Workplace by the Cincinnati Enquirer Recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Mid-size Companies in 2021 Medpace ranks amongst top CROs for site ratings across all 10 important attributes including CRA training, preparation & organization, accessibility of staff, open communication, and ensuring timely drug availability Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility Ranked in the top 10 on the 2021 LinkedIn Top Companies list in Cincinnati What to Expect Next: A member of our recruitment team will review your qualifications and, if interested, you will be contacted for an interview. Job Category Customer Success GroupJob Details Director - Customer Transformation - Singapore Job Details Director, Customer Transformation Advisor plays the critical role for setting customers up for Success by prescriptively crafting and then leading the execution of large and ground-breaking projects at our most strategic customers. This role serves as a trusted advisor to Salesforce customers, providing guidance to Sales & Professional Services teams, ensuring alignment across each customer's projects, and ensuring the highest levels of customer happiness. Partnered with a Account Partner (Services Sales person), the advisor leads both pre and post sales activities, acting as the Delivery guide across the portfolio of products and engaging other SMEs across the organisation to develop and articulate comprehensive implementation proposals. They will then maintain the executive relationships and act as a partner concern point within these implementations in a billable capacity, ensuring tight customer alignment, offering proactive and prescriptive advice resulting in outstanding Customer Success. The ideal candidate possesses the outstanding combination of aggressive prowess, consultative selling and hand's on transformation experience. You are able to tap these capabilities appropriately, to work with our most daring customers to help them achieve success with the Salesforce Professional Services. You develop and nurture valuable relationships with our most strategic Customers. Marrying Customer strategies with our Services, we enable Customers to adapt to a rapidly evolving landscape by understanding needs. We recommend the right services and solutions, that quickly drive outcomes and tangible business value for our Customers. Responsibilities : With the Professional Services sales team - identify and qualify opportunities for large transformation deals in the region Establish critical senior relationships with key Customer partners and develop and lead a custom narrative to ensure the why now, why us and how to queries are answered. Leading the development of client-specific implementation proposals, engaging with SMEs across the organization to gain consensus on an acceptable proposal Aligning closely with Account and Services Sales teams to own pre-sales customer discussions and activities such as prioritising and designing the best solution for the customer. Provide the Professional Services team with Subject Matter Expertise related to the proposed solution and client needs in order to ensure successful project delivery Providing a measurable value framework and baselining the key metrics of the programme in the initial stages. Also, work closely with the customer to set up a CoE ensuring regular tracking of the metrics Where appropriate and required for Customer Success, providing ongoing relationship management to the project team and the customer during the full lifecycle of the engagement, acting as the partner concern point for both the customer and Salesforce delivery teams Lead multiple strategic clients simultaneously Represent Professional Services at SICs, Executive Round Tables and Executive Events Establish Thought leadership content specific to transformation and the region Your Impact, you Provide a vision for the most high profile areas of the organization. Have a high level of knowledge of your specialty both internally and externally. Work on advanced sophisticated or critical business issues that require innovative technical or industry knowledge. Have wide latitude in settling objectives and approaches to critical assignments. Take decisions that will affect alignment of resources from cross-functional teams and marketing around technological / business initiatives and have meaningful impact on our technical / Business strategy and our company success. Preferred Qualifications & Skills: Direct transformation experience on the customer side and 6+ years experience delivering consulting services, including team leadership and active involvement in selling professional services 6+ years operating in a pre-sales environment, shaping and scoping large and sophisticated implementation projects 6+ years of enterprise-level project or program management experience Confirmed technical and/or functional proficiency, and ability to engage with architects or SME into pre-sales activities. Very strong written and verbal communication skills, executive level presence and experience in working in a client advisory role Consistent track record to influence a group audience, facilitate solutioning and lead discussions such as implementation methodology, Road mapping, Enterprise Transformation strategy, and executive-level requirement gathering sessions Excellent analytical & problem solving skills Public speaking experience About Salesforce: Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three radical ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to phenomenal heights, including being named one of Forbes's World's Most Innovative Company five years in a row and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for family) made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world. #LI-yAccommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this .Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. and are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. and do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. and will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with or . Salesforce welcomes all.

Job Summary Due to our continued growth, we are in need of qualified and focused individuals, like yourself. This is a vital role with our Clinical Safety team whose success relies upon your finely tuned skills and background. If you are ready to make a difference, you must be able to accomplish these tasks: Responsibilities Implementation of routine system configuration including product, study and license in Argus and Argus J; Assist with creating reports using Oracle Business Intelligence reporting tool; Resolve safety database-related issues; Prepare/Execute User Acceptance Testing (UAT) of safety system changes; Assist in Argus Database Training for new users, as applicable; Generate outputs from the global safety system in support of periodic safety reports (e.g. DSUR, PSUR and PBRER) ; Assist in the development of system support related process, SOPs, Work Instructions and manuals and Support Inspection and Audits. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in scientific discipline or Business Informatics or similar area with 1-2 years of directly related experience; Preferred Qualifications: Work experience in CRO/biotech/pharmaceutical industry. Experience in Study configurations in Safety Systems. Experience with Safety Database preferably Argus and Argus J. Experience in SQL. Experience in reporting and analytic platforms such as OBIEE. Strong client service orientation. Strong consultative problem-solving skills. Ability to combine technical problem-solving skills with discernment to resolve best business solution. Medpace Overview Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its scientific and disciplined approach. We leverage local regulatory and therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, employing more than 4,500 people across almost 40 countries. Why Medpace? When you join Medpace, you become part of a team dedicated to supporting the development of ground-breaking drugs and devices. Our employees provide hope for those living with debilitating diseases. We invite you to be a part of something that is impacting millions of people around the globe while enjoying a competitive total compensation and benefits package and internal growth opportunities. Organic Growth: Medpace is continuing to grow in all areas globally and has built an expansive research campus at its headquarters in Cincinnati, OH. In 2020, Medpace opened a new seven story building that is approximately 250,000 SQFT. In total, the headquarter's campus includes five buildings and approximately 600,000 SQFT. The company also has expanding office locations in Dallas, TX and Denver, CO. Perks (vary by location and position): On-site fitness center(s) Campus walking paths Company-sponsored social and wellness events Official Sponsor of FC Cincinnati Hybrid work-from-home options and flexible work schedule On-site Market Place Free and covered parking Discounts for local businesses On campus restaurants and banks coming soon Awards: Medpace historically named a Top Cincinnati Workplace by the Cincinnati Enquirer Recognized by Forbes as one of America's Best Mid-size Companies in 2021 Medpace ranks amongst top CROs for site ratings across all 10 important attributes including CRA training, preparation & organization, accessibility of staff, open communication, and ensuring timely drug availability Continually recognized with CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine based on expertise, quality, capabilities, reliability, and compatibility Ranked in the top 10 on the 2021 LinkedIn Top Companies list in Cincinnati What to Expect Next: A member of our recruitment team will review your qualifications and, if interested, you will be contacted for an interview.
